title.rendered: Find Rooms For Rent in San Antonio

content.rendered:
Moving to a new city is always so exciting. Experiencing the culture, the history and the heritage of a city for the first time is such a magical experience. Especially if the city in question is San Antonio. One of the most exciting cities in the US, San Antonio has everything you could want from a place and more! Brilliant architecture, a stunning art scene and the most delicious food you’ve ever tasted, San Antonio has it all! Whether you’re only toying with the idea of moving or you’re in the process of finding rooms for rent in San Antonio, we are here to help! From renting an apartment to finding roommates in San Antonio, we can guide you every step of the way. So, let’s start by getting to know the city a little better!

Related: 15 Best Things To Do In San Antonio

Getting to know San Antonio

There’s a reason why San Antonio is the most visited city in all of Texas. The city has a thriving art scene, some of the most stunning colonial architecture in the country and, of course, Tex-Mex food. Of course, like the rest of Texas, San Antonio also has a subtropical climate. Which means the winters are quite pleasant but the summers are excruciatingly hot. Oh well, the vibrant culture more than makes up for it!

It’s home to five-time NBA champion San Antonio Spurs. On top of that, it also hosts the annual San Antonio Livestock Show and Rodeo! This city really knows how to have fun.  So, the question isn’t if you should move to San Antonio, but when!

Finding rooms for rent in San Antonio

San Antonio boasts of being one of the most affordable cities in Texas. The median home price is $121,100, while the median monthly rent is $1,002. Here is a city that is both exciting and affordable! While there certainly are expensive neighborhoods in San Antonio, renting an apartment with roommates can make it a lot easier. So, depending on the neighborhood, finding affordable rooms for rent in San Antonio shouldn’t be a problem at all!

Find Rooms for Rent in San Antonio on Roomi!

Top neighborhoods

  • Alamo Heights: We highly recommend finding rooms for rent here in this iconic neighborhood of San Antonio. But rent is a bit steep here in this part of San Antonio, so you might want to try renting an apartment with roommates here.
  • Monte Vista: Finding rooms for rent in this part of San Antonio is a dream come true for many. It has the most stunning 20th century residential architecture. Moreover, renting an affordable apartment in Monte Vista, San Antonio shouldn’t be too hard.
  • Southtown: This is the arts district of San Antonio. If you live here, you might be roommates with the most artistic people in San Antonio. This is still a pretty up-and-coming neighborhood in San Antonio, so renting an apartment for cheap is easy!

Average rent in San Antonio

As the property value in downtown San Antonio increases, surrounding neighborhoods have also become more expensive. So, If you’re looking for rooms for rent in San Antonio, be mindful of this trend. We recommend renting an apartment with roommates to cope with this increase.

University life in San Antonio

If you’re a student considering going to school in San Antonio, there’s some great news for you! Not only do you get to experience the rich history and culture of this great city, you also get to do it without breaking the bank. That’s right, San Antonio is a very affordable city for students to live in! The average cost of living in San Antonio is much lower than the national average. The approximate monthly expenses for one person come up to about $829.88, not including rent. You can make San Antonio even more affordable by renting an apartment with roommates!

So, if you’re looking for well-rounded education in a beautiful city, we strongly recommend giving San Antonio a chance!

Here are the top 5 universities in San Antonio according to USNews:

  • University of the Incarnate Word
  • Trinity University
  • Texas Lutheran University
  • St. Mary’s University of San Antonio
  • Our Lady of the Lake University

How transit friendly is San Antonio

San Antonio commute is actually quite a pleasant experience. The city is fairly easy to navigate, the traffic isn’t too bad and there’s some quirky transportation options available for you. Here’s how you get around the city!

Walkability

San Antonio is not the most walkable city in the world. Most people here drive to get around, which is by far the easiest and the most convenient. However, Downtown San Antonio is quite walkable with a Walk Score of 96!

Roads/traffic

The average one-way commute time in San Antonio, 24.1 minutes, is actually shorter than the natural average. It might take some time to get used to the freeways and suburbs, but, that’s what Google Maps is here for!

Taxis

While Uber and Lyft are popular options, you can also use Yellow Cab. Keep in mind, it’s a little hard to find cabs on the street. You can also try the river taxi. Yes, that’s right, the city has a river taxi! Go Rio has river-taxis that run along the Downtown Reach and Museum Reach sections of the River Walk daily from 10am to 9pm.

Public Transportation

Public transportation isn’t the most popular option here, but that doesn’t mean you don’t have any viable options! The VIA Metropolitan Transit Service offers regular bus services at the extremely reasonable fare of $1.30.

Airports

The San Antonio International Airport is just 10 miles away from the center of the city.

Cycle-Friendly

The city has a public bike-share program called the San Antonio Bike Share. It’s great for short trips around the city!

Restaurants

Once you try the food of San Antonia, no other place will be able to satiate your appetite. It’s that good. While Tex-Mex is the soul of San Antonio, there’s a lot of other options as well. The culinary landscape in the city is evolving so fast, that it can be hard to keep up with it. So, here are some places you must absolutely check out!

  • 2M Smokehouse
  • Rosario’s Mexican Cafe Y Cantina
  • Battalion
  • Dough Pizzeria
  • Lulu’s Bakery and Cafe
  • Hot Joy

Historical Spots

San Antonio wouldn’t be San Antonio without its beautiful colonial architecture. These breathtaking historical spots are sure to delight everyone, even the most uninitiated. Here’s a list of historical places that you absolutely cannot miss while you live in San Antonio!

  • The Alamo
  • Tower of the Americas
  • San Fernando Cathedral
  • The Briscoe Western Art Museum
  • Rose Window
  • Spanish Governor’s Palace
